title.native: キャロル＆チューズデイ

description:
Fifty years have passed since mankind began migrating to the new frontier: Mars.
It's an age where most culture is produced by AI, and people are content to be passive consumers.

There's a girl.
Scrapping a living in the metropolis of Alba City, she's working part-time while trying to become a musician. She's always felt like something is missing.
Her name is Carole.

There's a girl.
Born to a wealthy family in the provincial town of Herschel City, she dreams of becoming a musician, but nobody around her understands. She feels like the loneliest person in the world.
Her name is Tuesday.

A chance meeting brings them together.
They want to sing.
They want to make music.
Together, they feel like they just might have a chance.

The two of them may only create a tiny wave.
But that wave will eventually grow into something larger...

(Source: Official Website)
synonyms: แครอลกับทูสเดย์

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Rotoscoping
tags.description: Animation technique that animators use to trace over motion picture footage, frame by frame, to produce realistic action.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Homeless
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is homeless.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Agender
tags.description: Prominently features agender characters.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

キャロル＆チューズデイ

name.native: チューズデイ・シモンズ
キャロル・ステンリー
アンジェラ・カーペンター

node.description:
Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.

Singer-songwriter from Tokyo, Japan.

[Website](http://celeinaann.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/celeinaann) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/celeinaann/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChGHCEmDXeowLbC_0s0PVZg) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@celeina_ann) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/celeinaann/)

American-Japanese singer songwriter, known for her appearance in the anime *[Carole & Tuesday](https://anilist.co/anime/101281)* as the singing voice for [Tuesday](https://anilist.co/character/133660). She started her YouTube channel “Celeina Ann’s Channel” in 2014 where she uploaded covers of her favorite pop songs, and within 6 months she was signed as a professional artist.

Singer born in New York, USA.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/naibr.xx) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nai_BrXX)

She started her YouTube channel “Celeina Ann’s Channel” in 2014 where she uploaded covers of her favorite pop songs, and within 6 months she was signed as a professional artist.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/naibr.xx) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nai_BrXX)

Most known for directing critically and commercially successful series, [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/) and [Samurai Champloo](https://anilist.co/anime/205/).

He is noted for blending together multiple genres in his anime. For example, in Cowboy Bebop, classic cowboy western mixes with '60s/'70s New York City film noir, jazz/blues music, Hong Kong action movies, and to top it off the series is set in space. In his later work, Samurai Champloo, he unites the cultures of Okinawa, hip hop, modern-day Japan, and chanbara.

[Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=naoyuki_konno)

__Naoyuki Konno__ is a Japanese animator and director. He is particularly known for his work on several adaptations of [Shoutarou Ishinomori's](https://anilist.co/staff/97478/Shoutarou-Ishinomori) works as well as his animation style, being renowned as one of the Kanada-school animators.

[Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=naoyuki_konno)

__Naoyuki Konno__ is a Japanese animator and director. He is particularly known for his work on several adaptations of [Shoutarou Ishinomori's](https://anilist.co/staff/97478/Shoutarou-Ishinomori) works as well as his animation style, being renowned as one of the Kanada-school animators.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshi_u)

Originating from [Tezuka Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/200/). Currently freelance, but often works for [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Notable works as a character designer include [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/), [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) and [Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshi_u)

Originating from [Tezuka Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/200/). Currently freelance, but often works for [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

Notable works as a character designer include [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/121/), [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) and [Space Dandy](https://anilist.co/anime/20057/).

**[SOUND BOX Profile (JP)](http://www.sound-box.jp/information/shizuo_k.html)** | **[SOUND BOX Profile (EN)](http://www.sound-box.jp/english/information/shizuo_k.html)**

Shizuo Kurahashi is a Japanese sound effects editor. He worked as an editor at the Nikkatsu filming studio. After that he started his sound career in ToyoOnkyo. 

He established his own company SOUND BOX in 1988. Since 1983, when the dolby stereo system got popular in Japan - he has been creating filmsounds. He has edited and arranged sounds for over 1000 works.
